div.head: TEI classes
div.p:
The TEI system currently defines 488 elements; to make this more manageable, they are grouped into 22 modules, but also into 83 classes. These classes perform two jobs:
The model classes provide a way of grouping syntactically or semantically similar elements together (for example, all elements which occur at the top of sections; or all elements which are to do with describing times and dates). These groups can then appear in the content models of other elements; this in turn makes the maintenance of those content models easier, as they are freed from worrying about, for example, new elements which describe times and dates, or deleted elements.
The attributes classes provide a way of allowing the same attributes on syntactically or semantically similar elements. For examples, all elements which are like divisions have a type attribute.

div.head: TEI macros
div.p: Macros (also called patterns in RelaxNG), are convenient shorthands for complex content models used in element definitions. There are 62 of them in the TEI, of which the important ones are listed below.
